page.title: 08DENBURY SCHOOL PLAY
page.content: On July 3rd & 4th the older children of Denbury School did a play called {"Kings and Things".}It was about waxwork dummies. All the waxworks were historical characters that came to life and spoke about themselves and the times in which they lived. It was a musical play with lots of songs, and parts for the instruments to play. Mrs Fraser taught the music. Miss Gordon was in charge of the costumes which were really lovely. My favourite part was the scene with Robin Hood, Maid Marian and King John. Mr Stroud,our Headmaster, was Robin Hood and looked very funny with green hair and a love-heart painted on his cheek. Melanie was Katherine Parr, one of Henry VIII's wives, and outlived him. {Melanie Ottewell,Victoria Paul {and Sarah Stonelake.}Aged 10
